name: Creamy Homemade Mac and Cheese
steps:
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add macaroni and cook according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
While pasta cooks, melt 4 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Whisk in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes until golden, creating a roux.
Gradually add warm milk, whisking constantly to prevent lumps.
Continue cooking and whisking for 5-7 minutes until sauce thickens and coats the back of a spoon.
Remove from heat and stir in 2 cups of cheddar cheese and all of the Gruyère cheese until smooth and melted.
Season with salt, pepper, paprika, and dry mustard.
Add cooked macaroni to the cheese sauce and stir until well coated.
Transfer to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
In a small bowl, mix panko breadcrumbs with melted butter and parmesan cheese.
Sprinkle remaining 1 cup of cheddar cheese over the macaroni, then top with breadcrumb mixture.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown and bubbly.
Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
